subject: Negotiation
title: Religious Observances in Business
description: Learn Religious Observances in Business in one minute.

hook.text: Scheduling a meeting during Ramadan fasting hours and serving lunch? That's a deal-breaking mistake.

buildup.text: Religious practices affect scheduling, dietary needs, prayer times, and negotiation rhythms worldwide.

discovery.text: In Israel, no business happens on Shabbat. In Gulf states, meetings may pause five times daily for prayer.

twist.text: Acknowledging and accommodating religious practices shows respect that builds trust faster than any tactic.

climax.text: Check the religious calendar before scheduling. Ask about dietary needs. Small adjustments earn enormous goodwill.

punchline.text: Respect their faith and they'll respect your deal.

quiz.question: How should negotiators handle religious observances?
